Package backend

Class Database<T extends DatabaseItem>

java.lang.Object
backend.Database<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the entry must have an id to identify different entries
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Database<T extends DatabaseItem>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
This class is used to store a list of items with methods provided to update entries of that list. The list of items is stored using a Linked List in .ser files. Any object being stored must be serializable. Code is partially taken from logging.zip, StudentManager.java from week 6 slides and codes
See Also:
Serialized Form

    For storing the file path of the .ser file

  • Constructor Details

    • Database

      public Database​(java.lang.String filePath) throws java.io.IOException
      For storing the file path of the .ser file
      Parameters:
      filePath - must take in .ser file
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if creating a file causes issues

  • Method Details

    • update

      public T update​(T newItem)
      Updates the list with a new entry for the same id, if that entry exists
      Parameters:
      newItem - the item to replace to existing entry (if it exists)
      Returns:
      the old item in the entry, if it doesn't exist then the new item is returned

    • delete

      public void delete​(java.lang.String id)
      Deletes an entry in the list of items if it exists
      Parameters:
      id - the entry id

    • populate

      public T populate​(java.lang.String id) throws EntryNotFoundException
      Returns the object instance equivalent of the id given
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the object that is requested
      Returns:
      the object instance of the id
      Throws:
      EntryNotFoundException - if the id given does not exist in the list of items

    • contains

      public boolean contains​(java.lang.String id)
      whether the database contains the id
      Parameters:
      id - the id being checked
      Returns:
      whether the database contains the id

    • getItems

      public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​T> getItems()
      list of items in the database file
      Returns:
      all the items in the file

    • save

      public void save​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​T> items) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Overwrites the file and saves something new to it
      Parameters:
      items - the items that are being saved to the file
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file doesn't exist
